Notes: Sow on surface, needs light to germinate.
Needs warmth. Taller varieties need staking.
Pinch out tips when 10 cm tall for bushier growth.

How to Overwinter: Tender. Can be overwintered in a frost-free polytunnel.

Notes: Needs a period of cold to germinate well (stratification). Sow in a cold polytunnel.
Soak seeds overnight. Can be sown directly.

How to Overwinter: Tender. Overwinter a potted plant in a frost-free polytunnel.
Take cuttings as insurance and overwinter in polytunnel.
Notes: Grown for foliage. Pinch out tips and remove flower spikes.

How to Overwinter: Lift and store crowns in dry compost.
Will form a small tuber. Can be lifted and stored like larger Dahlias.
Take cuttings or overwinter parent plant in a frost-free polytunnel.
Notes: All parts are highly toxic. Soak seeds for 24 hours.

How to Overwinter: Hardy biennial. Discard after flowering (will likely self-seed).
Notes: Sow on surface – needs light to germinate.

How to Overwinter: Take cuttings as insurance, or pot up and bring into a frost-free polytunnel.
Tender. Bring potted plants into a heated greenhouse or conservatory.
Tender. Take cuttings to overwinter in the polytunnel.
Take cuttings and overwinter in a bright, frost-free place.
Tender. Lift tubers in autumn and store in a dry, frost-free place.

Notes: Benefits from a period of cold.

How to Overwinter: Tender. Take cuttings or lift parent plant to overwinter in polytunnel.
Take cuttings in late summer to overwinter in the polytunnel.

Notes: Do not cover seed as it needs light to germinate.

How to Overwinter: Tender. Pot up and bring into a frost-free polytunnel for winter.
Take cuttings to overwinter (e.g. Salvia farinacea).

Notes: Pinch out tips to encourage bushiness.

How to Overwinter: Tender. Pot up and bring into a frost-free polytunnel for winter.
Notes: Soak seeds for 24 hours before sowing.

How to Overwinter: Take cuttings in late summer to overwinter young plants.
